subject: Re: [junit] Can we have multiple runs for a single test method of the Unit test case
msgSnippet: ... Stress/load testing mainly. It s also useful with the partial failure feature of TestNG: @Test(invocationCount = 1000, successPercentage = 98) public
messageBody:
On 11/22/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>
> Cedric,
>
> What could be value of repeated test alone?
>
> In JUnit 3 I'm using RepeatedTest together with ActiveTestSuite to
> perform rudimentary concurrency testing, but that is about it.


Stress/load testing mainly.

It's also useful with the "partial failure" feature of TestNG:

@Test(invocationCount = 1000, successPercentage = 98)
public void sendSms() {
}

This test will succeed if at least 980 invocations pass. This is convenient
when testing for unreliable networks or robustness in the face of a randomly
simulated failure.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
